resources.string: The app will close when you update it. Save any unsaved data before updating.
A game is in progress. No alerts during games is turned on.
Changing to High performance will improve your game performance.
Changing to Save power will reduce your power use.
Check out new games for your Samsung DeX
Check your gameplay history in My games.
Enhance your gameplay experience with Samsung DeX.
Gameplay videos recorded from your phone.
Games will open muted. You can change the volume later.
Game icons are shown only in Game Launcher. Game icons currently displayed on Home and Apps screens are hidden. To change this setting, go to Game Launcher settings.
Game icons will be shown only in Game Launcher. The game icons you currently have on the Home and Apps screens will be hidden. You can change this option in Game Launcher Settings.
Game Tools keeps all your games in one place.
Here you can see your most played games, recommended games, and game categories.
If you want access to handy gaming features, press and hold the icon, then select List as game.
Lock edge touch prevents accidental phone edge contact during gameplay. You can change this setting in Game Tools.
No alerts during game turned on.
No alerts while using app is on.
Performance tuning adjusts the performance of the game. Selecting High performance improves performance but may increase power use. Selecting Save power saves power but may reduce performance.
Pressure touch lock prevents accidental screen contact during gameplay. You can change this setting in Game Tools.
Press and hold, then tap Game details to see game information.
Save power reduces power use during games, but can also lower game performance.
See the current app version and legal information.
Select the function you want to assign to the shortcut. You can also touch and hold the shortcut to change it.
These Terms and Conditions apply to Game Launcher and Game Tools.
The Game Tools button lets you:
"The game volume will be muted, but your phone volume won't change. To turn off Mute game, press one of the Volume keys during gameplay."
The Hard press button lock prevents accidental screen contact during gameplay. You can change this setting in Game Tools.
The Hard press Home button lock prevents accidental screen contact during gameplay. You can turn this on or off in Game Tools.
The maximum recording file size is 4 GB. At the highest quality setting, you can record around 80 minutes of video. To increase recording time, lower the resolution and bit rate.
"The navigation bar doesn't auto-hide during games. This isn't recommended with full screen mode."
Tip: Press and hold the shortcut, or change the shortcut in Game Tools settings.
To hide the Game tools icon, drag it to the top of the screen.
To record gameplay videos, enable Game Launcher.
To stop recording, tap the Stop button on the navigation bar. You can also tap stop in the Quick Panel.
To stop recording, tap the Stop button on the navigation bar.
Try out useful features such as Save power, Open muted and Game Tools.
Use a lower resolution and frame rate to save battery life.
Use a lower resolution to save battery life.
Videos recorded using Game Tools will appear here.
"You can set the navigation bar so it's always displayed."
Display game icons in Apps and Game Launcher
"Here you can find the most played games and recommended games based on Galaxy users' game play data."
I agree to receive marketing information.
I agree to receive marketing information. (optional)
I have read and agree to all the Terms and Conditions above.
I have read and agree to the Terms of Service, Privacy Policy and Runtime permission above.
"Can't save power while playing a game in HD."
Change the Apps that can appear on top.
Drag the Game Tools icon to the desired location on the left or right side of the screen.

"File size: %d MB
We recommend you download using Wi-Fi. Using your mobile network may result in additional charges."
Game icons will display in Game Launcher only. You can change this option in Game Launcher Settings.
Get notifications for promotions and marketing information from %s.
Hide game icons on Apps screen?
Reset Save power setting to default?
Restart the game to avoid screen distortion and errors.
There are no game details available.
The app will close to update the list.
The Game Launcher icon will be removed from your Home screen and Apps. You can enable Game Launcher in Settings.
"This app wasn't added as a game. To use %s features on the app, add it as a game."
To apply your new power settings, restart any games that are currently running.
To change the screen view, restart your game.
To use Game Launcher, you need to turn on Apps that can appear on top in Game Launcher.
To view in full screen, restart your game.
To view in full screen, restart your game. Full screen mode may cause game to display incorrectly.
To view recorded gameplay videos, enable Game Launcher.
"You won't see game icons on the Apps screen."
Enhance your game experience with the High performance setting in Game Launcher.
Enjoy a free game from Samsung.
Enjoy longer games with the Save power setting in Game Launcher.
Game icons are shown only in Game Launcher.
Game icons on Apps are shown only in Game Launcher.
Game Launcher was turned on automatically so you can manage your games in one place. To turn it off, go to Settings.
Manage all your games in one place and try out cool features.
Manage and launch your games with Game Launcher.
Record audio from the game. System sounds from your phone may also be recorded.
Record audio from the game. System sounds from your tablet may also be recorded.
See the current app version and legal information.
Show game icons only in Game Launcher.
Your phone temperature is high, so the brightness of the screen has been reduced.
Hide games on Home and Apps
App can only be displayed in full screen.
Battery low. Recording stopped and saved.
"Can't connect to server. Try again later."
"Can't record videos larger than %1$d %2$s. Recording stopped and saved."
"Can't record voice. Game audio volume too high."
"Can't use Game Launcher features with non-game apps. To use these features, press and hold app to list as game."
"Can't use Game Launcher with non-game apps. To use features, press and hold app to list as game."
"Can't use %1$s. Set notifications to allow %2$s permission/permissions."
"Couldn't take screenshot. Delete some files and try again."
Game Discovery not available in this country yet.
Game icon moved to Game Launcher.
"Game Launcher features aren't available for %s. It can take up to 5 seconds to apply changes."
Game Launcher features are available for %s. It can take up to 5 seconds to apply changes.
"Game shown in full screen view. If it doesn't look right, turn off Full screen."
Not enough space to continue recording. Video saved.
Not enough space to record video. Delete some files and try again.
No alerts during games enabled. All alerts will be muted and hidden during gameplay. Only incoming calls will be displayed on screen.
No longer on game screen. Recording stopped and saved.
Recording stopped after %d seconds. Video not saved.
Recording stopped because of problem with phone. Video not saved.
Recording stopped because of problem with tablet. Video not saved.
"Screen view can't be changed right now."
See recorded video in Game Launcher.
Tap here to turn off Mute game.
"This game can't be launched in Samsung DeX mode."
This navigation bar is always displayed for the current game. Some game screens may overlap.
Voice may not be recorded if game volume too high.
"Can't check for updates. Your phone isn't connected to a network."
Connect to a Wi-Fi network or turn on Data roaming.
Connect to a Wi-Fi network or turn on Mobile data.
"There isn't enough space in your phone's internal storage. Delete some files or uninstall unused apps, then try updating again by downloading the updates from an app store."
Using mobile data while roaming may result in additional charges.
"Your phone isn't connected to a Wi-Fi network. To use a mobile network instead, turn off Airplane mode in Settings."
"Your phone isn't connected to a Wi-Fi network. Using mobile data may result in additional charges."
Unable to open %s while Easy mode enabled.
The latest version is already installed.
A network error has occurred. Tap RETRY to try again, or download the updates later from an app store.
%s needs to use network connections to work normally. Allow?
"Some of %s's features need to use network connections to work normally. Allow?"
Turn on Mobile data to use a mobile network or download the updates later from an app store.
Unable to open %s. Tap SETTINGS, go to Application info > Permissions, then allow the following permissions and try again:
Unable to use %s. Tap SETTINGS, go to Application info > Permissions, then allow the following permissions and try again:
Your device is not connected to a Wi-Fi network. Downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
To use %s, tap SETTINGS, go to Application info > Permissions, then allow the following permissions:
Apps that can appear on top
"Can't change this setting while %s is on."
To unpin application, press and hold the recents and back keys at the same time.
Consent for Collection and Use of Personal Information (For Game Launcher)

"The Company has established certain procedures necessary for revising the Privacy Policy in order for its continuous improvement. In addition, when a revision of the Privacy Policy is deemed necessary, a version number is given to it so that you can easily identify the details of the revision. This Policy is effective as of 8th August, 2016, and any revisions will be announced via the website (or individually notified in writing, Email, phone, SMS, etc.)."

"1. Information We Collect and How We Collect It (1) Information We Collect The Company collects the following information from you when you sign up for or use our services. Required Information Information about your device model, Universal Unique Identifier (UUID), IP address, device OS, time zone, MCC, MNC, configuration, the application package installed on your device, and your service usage records The Company does not collect sensitive information that may significantly infringe your privacy (ideology, convictions, membership in or withdrawal from unions or political parties, political opinion, information about health and sex life, etc.)."

"As a general rule, the Company does not collect your information if you are under 14 years of age. If the Company must collect personal information from a user under 14 years of age for use of the service, it will obtain the consent of a legal guardian in advance, manage the personal information meticulously while the work is in progress, and destroy the information without delay as soon as the related work is completed."

"(2) How We Collect Personal Information Collection in the course of running or using the Game Launcher service Collection through the user‘s device Sweepstake entries and participation in events Collection through tools that collect auto-generated information The Company has established a procedure that allows you to select “I agree” or “I do not agree” to each provision of the Consent for Collection and Use of Personal Information document."

"2. How We Use Information We Collect We use the information we collect for the following purposes: (1) To provide you with services pursuant to a contract To automatically place newly installed game applications in the Game Launcher To provide useful features such as “Save power during game”, “No alerts during game”, “Game Tools”, etc. To provide services optimized for the user (providing customized content and recommendations based on past service usage) (2) To improve services and to utilize in advertising, marketing, etc. Statistical analysis, prediction of market trends, improvement of services, and research/development of new services To deliver advertising information, including events or special offers, and provide services and advertisements according to the characteristics of the demographic"

"3. Information Retention and Usage Period In principle, your personal information shall be destroyed without delay after the purpose for which the information was collected and used has been achieved. However, if the provisions of the relevant laws and regulations make it necessary for the Company to retain your personal information, the Company may retain your personal information in accordance with the applicable provisions as described below. In such cases, the Company shall transfer the personal information to a separate database (DB) or a different storage location."

"5 years for records related to the retraction of contracts or subscriptions (Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.) 5 years for records of payments and the supply of goods (Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.) 3 years for records of the handling of consumer complaints or disputes (Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.) 3 years for records of the collection, handling and usage of credit information (Use and Protection of Credit Information Act) 6 months for records of display/advertising (Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.) 3 months for internet logs/location tracking data (Protection of Communications Secrets Act) 6 months for other data used for verifying communication (Protection of Communications Secrets Act)"

"4. Procedure and Method for Destroying Personal Information Your personal information will be destroyed via the following procedure and method: (1) Procedure for destruction Your personal information will be transferred to a separate DB (if in paper form, to a separate filing cabinet) after its purpose has been achieved, and will be preserved for a certain period of time in accordance with internal policies and grounds for protection of information under other relevant laws (see Information Retention and Usage Period), and then destroyed. Personal information transferred to a separate DB shall not be used for any other purpose other than storage, unless otherwise required by the law."

"(2) Method for destruction Personal information stored in the form of electronic files shall be deleted using technological methods that disable its playback. Personal information printed on paper shall be shredded or incinerated."

"5. Consignment and Overseas Transfer of Personal Information Collected The Company entrusts the processing of personal information to special outside agencies, as below, to provide its services. The processing of personal information shall be entrusted to a designated agency for a specific service only if necessary for its fulfillment."

"1. Information We Collect Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. (hereinafter the “Company”) collects the following information from you when you sign up for or use our services. When you consent to the collection and use of your personal information, you have the right to refuse permission for the collection and use of personal information that is not required by the service. For more information about how we process your information, please refer to our Privacy Policy, which can be accessed via Game Launcher’s Settings > About Game Launcher screen. However, in case of any inconsistency or conflict between the terms of this Agreement and the Privacy Policy, the terms of this Agreement shall prevail."

"When responsibility for the processing of personal information is transferred to another organisation, in order to ensure the protection of personal information, the Company shall clearly define strict observance of instructions regarding the protection of personal information, confidentiality regarding personal information, prohibition against providing the information to a third party, and the assumption of liability in case of an incident, period of transferral, the return or destruction of personal information after the completion of its processing, etc., and the Company shall supervise to ensure that the agency processes personal information safely. In the event that there is a change in the agency or the work to be outsourced, it will be announced via a website notification (or individually notified in writing or by Email, phone, SMS, etc.)"

"6. Providing Personal Information to a Third Party As a general rule, the Company does not provide your personal information to third parties. However, there are exceptions as follows: Pursuant to the provisions of laws, or when required by investigative authority for investigative purposes in accordance with procedures and manners established by laws When it is necessary for billing paid services provided Where the information is provided after being processed in a form that cannot be used to identify a specific individual for statistical, academic or market research purposes Where the user has agreed to it in advance When your personal information is provided or shared, except as listed above, the information will be provided only after a separate procedure to obtain your consent."

"7. The Rights of the Users and Their Legal Representatives and How to Exercise Them Users and their legal representatives can always request access to, correction or deletion of, an end to the processing of, and withdrawal of consent with regards to the use of the personal information of the registered user him/herself or a user under 14 years of age. You can call us on our primary phone number (1588-3366) or contact the Privacy Officer in writing, by phone or by Email. We will take the necessary measures without delay. In the following cases, the Company may refuse to give access to, correct, or delete all or part of your personal information: Where access is prohibited or restricted by law Where it may cause harm to the life or body of another or unduly infringe on the property or other interests of another"

"When the user requests correction of an error in personal information, the personal information concerned will not be used or provided to a third party until the correction has been completed. In addition, in the event that the wrong information has been already provided to a third party, we will notify the third party of the corrected result without delay. When a user or his/her legal representative requests a deletion or an end to the processing of personal information, the Company will process it as set out in “3. Information Retention and Usage Period” and ensure that it is not accessed or used for any other purpose."

"Please enter your latest personal information accurately. You are responsible for any incidents that occur due to inaccurate information you enter, and if you enter false information such as information stolen from another, you may lose your membership privileges. You have the obligation to protect yourself and not to infringe on the information of another, as well as the right to have your information protected. Please be careful not to leak your personal information, including your password, and be careful not to damage the personal information of another, including any posts. You may be subject to sanctions or penalties under the “Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, etc.” or other related laws if you fail to fulfill such responsibilities and harm another person’s information and dignity."

"8. Installation, Operation, and Rejection of a System That Collects Personal Information Automatically (applicable only if subject to the Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, etc.) The Company utilizes “cookies” that frequently store and find the user’s information. Cookies are very small text files that are sent to the user’s browser by the server used to operate the Company’s website, and are stored on the hard disk of the user’s computer."

"(1) Purposes of cookies Cookies are used for the following purposes: implementation of automatic login feature, analysis of access frequency or access time by members and non-members, identifying the preferences and interests of users and tracing the users, providing targeted marketing and personalized services by identifying the participation rate at various events, and the number of visits. (2) How to block cookies You have the right to choose regarding the installation of cookies. Therefore, you can set options in your web browser to allow all cookies, require your confirmation every time a cookie is stored, or block all cookies. However, you might encounter difficulty in using our services if you block cookies."

"How to set cookies (on Internet Explorer 8.0) : Select “Internet Options” from the “Tools” menu. Click on the “Privacy” tab. Use “Settings” to set the level of cookie usage that is acceptable for you. How to view cookies received (on Internet Explorer 8.0) : Select “Internet Options” from the “Tools” menu. Click on the “General” tab, click “Settings” in the “Browsing history” section, and then click “View files” to view them. How to block cookies (on Internet Explorer 8.0) : Select “Internet Options” from the “Tools” menu. Click on the “Privacy” tab. Use “Settings” to set the level to the highest level, “Block all cookies”."

"9. Other Policies Related to Privacy (1) Technical and administrative measures to protect your privacy The Company takes the following technical and administrative measures in handling your personal information, to ensure the safety of your personal information so that it will not be lost, stolen, leaked, altered or tampered with. The establishment and implementation of an internal management plan The Company has established and implemented an internal management plan to process your personal information safely. The Company checks whether privacy protection measures are carried out and ensures that the personnel in charge are in compliance with the in-house privacy task force, etc. The Company also commits to ensuring that appropriate corrective measures will be taken immediately should any problems be found."

"The installation and operation of the access control system The Company controls unauthorised access from outside by using an Intrusion Prevention System, and will endeavour to equip itself with all the technical systems available to procure security system-wise. Measures to prevent counterfeiting of and tampering with access records The Company stores and manages records of access to the personal information processing system and uses security features to prevent the counterfeiting of or tampering with such access records. The encryption of personal information Your personal information is password protected; it is stored and managed by encrypting files and transmission data or by file locking, and important data is protected by an additional security feature."

"Required Information Information about your device model, Universal Unique Identifier (UUID), IP address, device OS, time zone, MCC, MNC, configuration, the application package installed on your device, and your service usage records You may refuse permission for the collection and use of required information, but you will not be able to use our services, since this information is necessary for us to provide you with such services."

"Protection against hacking The Company uses anti-virus programs to prevent damage by computer viruses. Anti-virus programs are updated regularly, and when a new virus suddenly appears, updates are provided as soon as they become available, in order to prevent the breach of personal information. The Company has adopted an SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) that enables the secure transfer of personal information over the network by using an encryption algorithm. Each server uses an Intrusion Prevention System, vulnerability assessment system, etc. for a full defensive preparation against external intrusion such as hacking. Personal information is kept separate through a separate server, and not mixed with general information."

"Minimizing the number of the people in charge and educating them The Company restricts access to users’ personal information to those who work directly with users to carry out marketing functions, those who carry out personal information management (such as personnel in charge of privacy protection, etc.), and others who cannot avoid handling personal information due to the nature of their work. The Company provides employees who handle personal information with regular in-house training and outsourced training on new security technologies, duty to protect personal information, etc."

"The Company prevents the leakage of information by personnel via the security pledge that all employees must sign as a condition of their employment, and has proper internal procedures in place to inspect the implementation of the privacy policy and employee compliance. The transfer of duties and responsibilities of those that handle personal information takes place while thoroughly maintaining security, and responsibilities for privacy-related incidents, whether during or after the period of employment by the Company, are made clear. The computer room, data center and data storage room are set up as special protection areas and access to them is controlled."

"(2) Policy on providing links to websites The Company may provide users with links to the websites or resources of other companies, and users can use products and services developed by a third party through Samsung’s services. For example, a third-party application may be downloaded and used through Samsung Apps. In such cases, the Company has no control over the websites, resources, products, and services of the third party, so cannot be held responsible for or guarantee the usefulness of the products, services or resources provided. When you are redirected to a third party’s website by clicking a link on the Company’s website, the privacy policy of the redirected website is independent of the Company. Please review the privacy policy of the redirected website carefully."

"(3) Post administration policy The Company values your posts and shall try its best to protect them so that they are not altered, tampered with, or deleted. However, the following cases are exceptions: Spam-like posts Posts that defame others by spreading false information in order to slander them Posts that disclose the personal information of another without consent Posts that infringe on the rights of the Company or a third party (such as intellectual property rights) Posts that are unrelated to the topic of the board"

"In order to foster a desirable usage of boards, when the personal information of another is posted without consent, the Company can delete certain parts of the post or replace them with symbols, etc., and in cases where a post is moved to a board with a different subject matter, the transfer path will be specified in the post so that there are no misunderstandings. In other cases, the post may be deleted after an explicit or individual warning. Essentially, you have all the rights and responsibilities associated with your posts. In addition, information disclosed voluntarily through your posts cannot be protected, so please think carefully before disclosing information."

"(4) Policy of refusing unauthorised collection of Email addresses The Company refuses the unauthorized collection of posted Email addresses by use of an Email collection program or other technical measures. If you violate this policy, you may be subject to punishment pursuant to the “Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilisation and Information Protection, etc.” or related laws."
"(5) Transmission of advertising information The Company does not transmit advertising information for commercial purposes against your express wish to not receive them."

"If you have agreed to receive Emails such as product information, newsletters, etc., the Company will treat the subject and body of such Emails as follows, so that you can easily recognize them. The phrase “advertising material” does not have to be displayed on the subject line, and the main content of the body of the Email will be displayed on the subject line. The body of the Email will specify the name, Email address, and phone number of the sender that you can unsubscribe from and how you can easily unsubscribe. When advertising information for commercial purposes is transmitted through media other than Email, such as fax, SMS, etc., the Company will take necessary measures such as marking the beginning of the message with the phrase “advertising material” in accordance with applicable law."

"10. Information About the Privacy Officer and Customer Services Department The Company has a designated Privacy Officer and related departments to protect your personal information and to process complaints related to privacy. (1) Customer Services Department Customer Services Department: Graphic R&D Group, Mobile Communications Business, Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. Phone: 1588-4730 Contact us at: https://help.content.samsung.com (2) Privacy Officer and the department in charge of privacy-related work Privacy Officer: Privacy Secretariat Department in charge of related work: Global Privacy Office Phone: 1588-4730 Contact us at: privacy.sec@samsung.com"

"2. How We Use Information We Collect We use the information we collect for the following purposes: (1) To provide you with services pursuant to a contract To automatically place newly installed game applications in the Game Launcher To provide useful features such as “Save power during game”, “No alerts during game”, “Game Tools”, etc. To provide services optimized for the user (providing customized content and recommendations based on past service usage) (2) To improve services and to utilise in advertising, marketing, etc. Statistical analysis, prediction of market trends, improvement of services, and research/development of new services To deliver advertising information, including events or special offers, and provide services and advertisements according to the characteristics of the demographic"

"(3) Other institutions You can report all privacy-related complaints arising from the usage of the Company’s services to the Privacy Officer or the department in charge. The Company will promptly provide you with an adequate response. If you wish to report or seek advice on other privacy infringement, please contact the following institutions: Privacy Infringement Complaint Centre (www.118.or.kr / 118) Supreme Prosecutor’s Office; Internet Crime Investigation Centre (www.spo.go.kr / 02-3480-3600) National Police Agency; Cyber Terrorism Response Centre (www.ctrc.go.kr / 02-392-0330) Privacy Policy Version Number: V1.0 Privacy Policy Effective Date: 8th August, 2016"

"3. Information Retention and Usage Period In principle, your personal information shall be destroyed without delay after the purpose for which the information was collected and used has been achieved. However, if the provisions of the relevant laws and regulations make it necessary for the Company to retain your personal information, the Company may retain your personal information in accordance with the applicable provisions as described below."

"5 years for records related to the retraction of contracts or subscriptions (Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.) 5 years for records of payments and the supply of goods (Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.) 3 years for records of the handling of consumer complaints or disputes (Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.) 3 years for records of the collection, handling and usage of credit information (Use and Protection of Credit Information Act) 6 months for records of display/advertising (Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.) 3 months for internet logs/location tracking data (Protection of Communications Secrets Act) 6 months for other data used for verifying communication (Protection of Communications Secrets Act)"

"Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. (hereinafter “the Company”) values your personal information and is committed to compliance with the “Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, etc.” and the “Personal Information Protection Act”. Through this Privacy Policy, the Company informs you of for what purposes and in what manner it uses the personal information received from you and informs you of what measures are being taken to protect your privacy."

"0. General Provisions “Personal information” means information about a living individual that can be used to identify the individual concerned through data such as last name, first name, resident registration number, or social security number. It can include information that can be easily combined with other information to identify a specific individual, although it cannot be used by itself to identify that individual. The Company provides you with easy access to this Privacy Policy at all times by disclosing the Privacy Policy under Game Launcher’s Settings > About Game Launcher screen."

"Game Launcher - Privacy Notice This Privacy Notice is important, as it describes how your information will be collected, used, and shared to provide Game Launcher (“the Service”) to you. Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. (“Samsung”, “we”, “us”, “our”) will be responsible for such information and for collecting, using, and sharing it in accordance with this Privacy Notice. By using the Service, you will be deemed to have unconditionally agreed to the terms of this Privacy Notice. This Privacy Notice supplements the Samsung Privacy Policy (available at https://account.samsung.com/membership/pp) and in case of any inconsistency or conflict between the terms of this Privacy Notice and the Samsung Privacy Policy, the terms of this Privacy Notice shall prevail. Further information on how you can contact us with any questions regarding this Privacy Notice or our practices is set out below. "

"To whom do we disclose your information? We will not disclose your information to third parties for their own business purposes without your consent. However, we may disclose your information to third parties involved in the process of providing services on behalf of Samsung. Who should you contact if you have any questions? If you have any questions about Game Launcher, please contact us through our customer support channels. If you have any questions specific to your information, please contact us at: http://help.content.samsung.com "

4. Updates, Changes to or Suspension of the SERVICE

13.2 Arbitration. By using the SERVICE, you unconditionally consent and agree that: (i) any claim, dispute or controversy (whether in contract, tort, or otherwise) you may have against any Samsung entity, the officers, directors, agents and employees of any Samsung entity (the “Samsung Entity(ies)”) arising out of, relating to, or connected in any way with the SERVICE or the determination of the scope or applicability of this clause, will be resolved exclusively by final and binding arbitration administered by JAMS and conducted before a sole arbitrator in accordance with the rules of JAMS;

(ii) this clause is made pursuant to a transaction involving interstate commerce, and shall be governed by the Federal Arbitration Act (“FAA”), 9 U.S.C. §§ 1-16; (iii) the arbitration shall be held in New York City, New York; (iv) the arbitrator’s decision shall be controlled by the terms and conditions of these TOS and any other agreements referenced herein that you have agreed to in connection with the SERVICE; (v) the arbitrator shall apply New York law consistent with the FAA and applicable statutes of limitations, and shall honor claims of privilege recognized at law;

(vi) there shall be no authority for any claims to be arbitrated on a class or representative basis; arbitration can decide only your and/or the applicable Samsung Entity’s individual claims; the arbitrator may not consolidate or join the claims of other persons or parties who may be similarly situated; and you will not file or participate in a class action against us; (vii) the arbitrator shall not have the power to award punitive damages against you or any Samsung Entity; (viii) in the event that the administrative fees and deposits that must be paid to initiate arbitration against any Samsung Entity exceed One Hundred Twenty-Five US Dollars (US$125), and you are unable (or not required under the rules of JAMS) to pay any fees and deposits that exceed this amount, Samsung agrees to pay them and/or forward them on your behalf, subject to ultimate allocation by the arbitrator.

In addition, if you are able to demonstrate that the costs of arbitration will be prohibitive as compared to the costs of litigation, Samsung will pay as much of your filing and hearing fees in connection with the arbitration as the arbitrator deems necessary to prevent the arbitration from being cost prohibitive; and (ix) with the exception of subsection (vi) above, if any part of this arbitration provision is deemed invalid, unenforceable or illegal, or otherwise conflicts with the rules of JAMS, the balance of this arbitration provision shall remain in effect and shall be construed in accordance with its terms as if the invalid, unenforceable, illegal or conflicting provision were not contained herein.

If, however, subsection (vi) above is found to be invalid, unenforceable or illegal, the entirety of this arbitration provision shall be null and void, and neither you nor Samsung shall be entitled to arbitrate the dispute. For more information on JAMS and/or the rules of JAMS, visit their website at www.jamsadr.com.
